verbs.description: abnegate (third-person singular simple present abnegates, present participle abnegating, simple past and past participle abnegated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deny (oneself something); to renounce or give up (a right, a power, a claim, a privilege, a convenience). [First attested in the early 17th century.]
(transitive) To relinquish; to surrender; to abjure. [First attested in the mid 18th century.]
